name: Crowne Plaza Hotel London Ealing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed here at the Crowne Plaza Ealing as we were attending a concert at Wembley Stadium. I have to say that the hotel did exactly what we wanted it to. To be honest, we can't really comment on much at all as spent very little time here other than to sleep but I can say that the rooms, bathroom and beds were spotlessly clean and the bed and duvet were very cosy indeed!
reviews.title: Overnight weekend stay for 2

reviews.text: Very easy to get to from Kings Cross for us, basically 2 trains and about 50 minutes to get there and then as soon as you come up from Hanger Lane the hotel is directly in front of you.
reviews.title: Second stay - very satisfied
Close to wembley
reviews.text: We took a taxi from the hotel to Wembley and at £10 thought it was excellent value.
All in all, if we were to go back to Wembley I would certainly consider staying at the Crowne Plaza again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and staff.
Good rooms, little too close to traffic
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel which has not changed a bit in 3 years since my first stay. The first time I stayed as an employee of the chain, second time - as a regular guest and the service is equally prompt, friendly and nice. Rooms are spacious and look new. We did not try the breakfast or leisure facilities as we had no time. The only thing I would suggest is that more benefits be given to Priority Club base members other than a newspaper, but recognition was nice. Location is great even if you are sightseeing in central London as the tube station is literally below the hotel. Excellent place, would definitely come back.
5 of us stayed, Me my husband and our 14 year old son and another couple.
reviews.title: Weekend Visit

reviews.text: Me, my husband and son had the feature club / suit room which was lovely and spacious with a sofa bed which our 6 foot son says was comfy enough.
reviews.title: Very nice stay, 20-25 min from London's center. Read & watch here.

reviews.text: Big bath with tv... big double shower and nice big bathroom. Very Clean.
reviews.title: Great for Wembley

reviews.text: Bed not amazingly comfy but everything else in the room was fab.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Exec lounge well stocked and not busy - shame it shuts at 10 tho! Hors d'oeuves (snacks in the lounge) not tempting - even when hungry and tipsy!
reviews.title: Good location and great hotel

reviews.text: We (my family and I) stayed at this hotel in June for business that I had in north-west of London. We had the club room booked through Hotels.com. Unlike what is written on hotels.com site we were offered breakfast and access to the club lounge for evening snack. The evening snack was just few nuts and drink, so do not really count on it. The breakfast included simple bread, eggs to boil, three types of cheese, jam, some fruits, cereals, etc. So it was the level of what you normally eat at home.
reviews.title: good big comfy rooms

reviews.text: The hotel is just across the street from Central line station making it perfect for communication. There are also several eateries close by.
reviews.title: Ordinary hotel, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean. Our room which was just a little bit more expensive that other rooms was huge with a lot of space that you can almost never get on a similar budget in London.
reviews.title: crowne plaza ealing

reviews.text: You had to pay for wifi but it was available downstairs. I never give full credit to a hotel that does not provide free wifi no matter how cheap or expensive. We did not have time to use it. TV channels were very few.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff in a busy London hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here a few days ago for a night. Hotel is most other hotels, nothing distinguishing. But was pleasantly surprised to see the staff remember my name even the next day. Location is quite good for commuters with Hanger Lane station next door and Park Royal about 10 minutes walk away. If you are driving here, the entrance is in a lane on the right side of the hotel (while facing it), a bit tricky to figure out.
reviews.title: Really great surprise

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights midweek in June on a business trip. The hotel staff were very attentive and always willing to help. Room/bathroom was comfortable as expected for a Crowne Plaza. If ever i'm in West London on business again I would definitely stay here. It's close to my place of work but also has Central and Picadilly line stations not far from the front door.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, eat out if you're hungry.

reviews.text: I didn't know the area very well so fortunately I bumped into a couple of colleagues on the first night and we went to a local curry house for a meal which was very good
reviews.title: Nice hotel but expensive for the location

reviews.text: The second night I stayed in the hotel to eat and this is where I took issue slightly. The service was very good, and the food tasted nice; there just wasn't very much of it on the plate. I had the creamed goats cheese in a parmesan crisp with croutons for a starter and the whole thing had the volume of an average sized canape to be quite honest. Understandably, I was now worried that the days' special spiced lamb with aubergine caviar would follow suit. It did. The piece of lamb was perfectly cooked but occupied a couple of cubic inches, with the vegetable sides about the same. I appreciate that food and drink prices are usually inflated in hotels, but to pay £35 for food amounting to an average sized starter, I wasn't very impressed.
reviews.title: Perfectly situated for Wembley

reviews.text: Now I understand why there were only about 8 people in the restaurant. If I stay here again (which I probably will do), I'll most definitely eat out.
reviews.title: I Liked It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room only but was disappointed to get a room that had previously been used by a smoker. I asked if we could be moved to a non smoker room but were told that the hotel was full and it wasn't possible. I would make sure you mention when booking you mention this as the question isn't asked. The room apart from this was good size and very comfortable. We asked about breakfast as we booked room only and the price was £12.50 the night before and £16.50 on the day. We were going ti a concert at wembley and thought the hotel waa a bit far out. Too far to walk but there was a bus (no83) that you could catch or a taxi for £10 or £12.50 if booked through the hotel.
reviews.title: Wembley

description: The Crowne Plaza London Ealing is ideally located on the Hanger Lane Gyratory System close to Wembley (3 miles) and Heathrow Airport (12 miles) and with easy access to Central London by car or public transport. The hotel is also directly next to Hanger Lane Tube Station, on the Central Line of London's Underground. The hotel is also walking distance from Park Royal leisure park with restaurants and cinema. The Crowne Plaza London Ealing is ideally located to Europe s newest and largest inner city shopping centre, Westfield Shopping Centre. Only four stops away on the Central Line or a short drive by car.Five floors with 131 guest rooms, of which all were refurbished 2008. All rooms offer individually controlled air-conditioning as well as private facilities including tea/coffee making, trousers press, hair dryer, direct dial telephone, satellite TV, in house movies, wireless Internet connection, triple glazed and 24-hour room service. Club and Feature Club rooms are available on request with four piece bathroom suites, LCD TVs and MP3 player connections as well as exclusive access to the hotel's Club Lounge. West 5 Brasserie and Bar on the lower ground floor are the ideal destinations for unwinding, drinking and dining. For those seeking fitness revive Health Club with steam room is complimentary to all hotel guests. The hotel also offers 5 modern, light and professional meeting rooms.
